alert.note: Alert for Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 4:09PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive thunderstorm rainfall is expected. * WHERE...City of Cody. * WHEN...Until 700 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 356 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is likely to cause urban and small stream flooding, especially given the lack of storm drains in the city of Cody. Overflowing poor drainage areas could cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Spring Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Shoshone River, Sage Creek, Sulphur Creek and Trail Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cody and Cody Yellowstone Regional Airport.
